meanings.definition: Microscopic calcium carbonate plates produced by marine algae.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the coccoliths looked like tiny white plates.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the coccoliths to learn more about marine algae.
meanings.sent3: The coccoliths threw a tiny party to celebrate being discovered.
meanings.sent4: The coccoliths acted as shields, protecting the marine algae from harm.
meanings.sent5: The coccoliths sparkled in the sunlight, creating a beautiful underwater scene.

meanings.definition: Individual plates that make up the outer covering of certain types of algae.
meanings.sent1: Each coccoliths plate fit perfectly into the algae's outer layer.
meanings.sent2: The biologist examined the coccoliths to identify the algae species.
meanings.sent3: The coccoliths plates decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The coccoliths plates were like puzzle pieces completing the algae's armor.
meanings.sent5: The coccoliths plates danced gracefully around the algae, forming a protective shield.

meanings.definition: Tiny structures found in the ocean that play a role in the carbon cycle.
meanings.sent1: The coccoliths floated gently in the ocean, contributing to the carbon cycle.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the coccoliths to understand their impact on the environment.
meanings.sent3: The coccoliths organized a parade to showcase their importance in the carbon cycle.
meanings.sent4: The coccoliths were like tiny carbon cycle superheroes in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The coccoliths worked tirelessly to balance the carbon levels in the ocean.
